concept.title: What's New?
concept.shortdesc: This topic lists new features in 4.4.0.

row.entry: snapshots now can be stored as a delta to a previous checkpoint (delta or a full snapshot). Volume restore occurs from the first snapshot, plus the deltas. This feature is supported only when Ceph-RBD is used as the block storage backend provider for the Storage Controller (SC). The cloud administrator can set the maximum number of snapshot deltas between full volume checkpoints.
Cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) configuration for S3 buckets support.

CORS defines a way for client web applications that are loaded in one domain to interact with resources in a different domain. With CORS support in S3, you can build rich client-side web applications with S3 and selectively allow cross-origin access to your S3 resources.
In 4.4.0, VPCMIDO mode relies on MEM version 5 series (5.0.x and/or 5.2.x).
You can now log into the Management Console using InCommon identities, via Globus OAuth 2.0 authentication.
S3 now supports the SigV4 signing process for all previously supported operations.
The ELB service now uses the Simple Workflow service (SWF) to coordinate distributed tasks. This enhancement improves scalability and troubleshooting for the ELB service.

These features / components were deprecated in the 4.4.0 release:
Managed network modes
Reporting and data warehousing
